Technique: SCULPTURED ?; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Board of "Codex"
Description: This small well preserved wooden board bears Greek texts on two sides. The recto carries the integral text of Chapter 15 and 16 of the speech "To Nicoclem" (Or.II) of the Attic speaker Isocrate. On the versco, two texts, one of 6 to 7 lines and the other of 5 lines, can be distinguished. They are too faded to determine their content. The purpose of the board, which dates from the 4th - 5th century, is not clear: it could be a small tablet to be used in a school.
